availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles A. Clarke (Henry County, KY, farmer & lieut & QM in 9th KY)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Polly Clarke. Father of Susan M. Clarke, Sally Clarke, George Clarke, John Clarke, Eliza Jane Clarke, William Clarke, Charles Clarke, James Clarke, Nancy Clarke, Margret Clarke, Rice Clarke, Joseph Clarke, Martha Ellen Clarke, and Isaiah Clarke. Farmer in Henry County in 1850. Farmer in Henry County in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a lieutenant and quartermaster. Resigned on August 17, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, p. 435A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, p. 345.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 230-231.
KYR-0002-222-0011.
